item.title: RSC Security (video)
item.dc:creator: @malikz malikz
item.description:
@malikz wrote:

The problem is if someone whom the account doesn’t belong to, manages to get on the account…they can change all of your info without any problem (from what I see).

If it’s done through the game account, I think it should be sent as a request, and that the main platform for this should be hosted on the forums.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: RSC Security (video)
item.dc:creator: @da_real_hype da real hype
item.description:
@da_real_hype wrote:

Runescape moved away from the client security questions for a reason, so why go back to it? same goes for clients… like the public client’s you see are 202-204 yet the newest is like 240+ sure most of the updates past rsc days are to integrate rs2 chat systems etc into it but still could/would be better than a 202.

What i’m trying to say is they update for a reason

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Security (video)
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:7, topic:547074”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=665975.msg4452339#msg4452339 date=1412418710]

Maybe there should be a requirement for the password changing, like if you’re a verified member (phone verified or authed) && your ip = your creation ip or detected that its the same for the last 10 logins.

Using IP address for identification purposes is retarded.
[/quote]

You always lack the ability to think outside the box. I knew when I posted it someone would try to counter that, lol, obviously that’s not exactly how it would work. As long as the public doesn’t have intel on your system and know how to manipulate it. If by some chance the ip is the same as the creation ip then it should be an automatic change. In the private server world it’s not like likely that people are sharing the same computer like they use to, so it’s unlikely that they will have the same ip. Also if you have an ip check and that ip address is used on the account 95%+ of the time and in the scenario where you don’t have your system publicly available it should be automatically changed, if your ip is not used 95%+ of the time (or whatever % you want) then an email or some sort of verification should be sent off. Obviously this won’t work for everyone but a majority.

Then there is this, http://services.runescape.com/m=rswiki/en/RuneScape_Authenticator.[/quote]
There’s nothing to think “outside the box”. It is a bad way for identifying users and will always be.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Security (video)
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:4, topic:547074"][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=665975.msg4452304#msg4452304 date=1412390848]
Maybe there should be a requirement for the password changing, like if you’re a verified member (phone verified or authed) && your ip = your creation ip or detected that its the same for the last 10 logins.
[/quote]
Using IP address for identification purposes is retarded.[/quote]

You always lack the ability to think outside the box. I knew when I posted it someone would try to counter that, lol, obviously that’s not exactly how it would work. As long as the public doesn’t have intel on your system and know how to manipulate it. If by some chance the ip is the same as the creation ip then it should be an automatic change. In the private server world it’s not like likely that people are sharing the same computer like they use to, so it’s unlikely that they will have the same ip. Also if you have an ip check and that ip address is used on the account 95%+ of the time and in the scenario where you don’t have your system publicly available it should be automatically changed, if your ip is not used 95%+ of the time (or whatever % you want) then an email or some sort of verification should be sent off. Obviously this won’t work for everyone but a majority.

Then there is this, http://services.runescape.com/m=rswiki/en/RuneScape_Authenticator.

Go fix your bugs before replying.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Security (video)
item.dc:creator: @TechN9ne TechN9ne
item.description:
@TechN9ne wrote:

Very nice construction here, however I believe you should add at least a 3-day timer until changes to the security questions take affect. When you “relog” you should receive a message in the chat box stating how much time until the security changes will take affect, if the person did not request the change then they have the ability to change the password and discard the changed security questions.

Read full topic
